subject: RE: [junit] About the value of JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Mhh, what they call black box testing sounds *very* much like JUnit-style testing to me... Another interesting paper is
messageBody:
> JTest sounds very good to me, and I will test whether it will help
> our team to be more productive than using JUnit instead.
>
> This article is very interesting:
> http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-03-2001/jw-0323-lw-jtest.html

Mhh, what they call "black box testing" sounds *very* much like
JUnit-style testing to me...

Another interesting paper is
<http://www.parasoft.com/jsp/printables/TechPapers_Solutions_JavaT_Jtest
_WhitePaper_Resources_JavaTech_UnitTest_133.pdf>

(<http://makeashorterlink.com/?V52023E14>)

What makes me suspicious about the usefulness of Jtest is that all the
examples seem to be about *static* methods - I can't imagine how well it
will work for actual *object oriented* programs...

Regards, Ilja
